item.name: Local Signing (Non-production use-only)
IMS: JWT Generate + Auth via User Token

exec: console.log("Unable to acquire ACCESS_TOKEN from Adobe IMS to make further calls to Adobe I/O APIs.")
const ERROR_MESSAGE = " not found in active environment. Please ensure the correct environment is selected and populated.";
console.log("Loading JS RSA SIGN library from: " + JS_RSA_SIGN_LIBRARY_REQUEST.url);
console.log("Successfully loaded JS RSA Sign library.");
console.log("Could not load JS RSA Sign Library.");
// Already have the JS RSA Sign library loaded, so generate token immediately
var navigator = {}; //fake a navigator object for the lib
var window = {}; //fake a window object for the lib
throw new Error("Could not load JS RSA Sign Library from https://kjur.github.io/jsrsasign/jsrsasign-latest-all-min.js");
throw new Error("Ensure the Private Key is added to both INITIAL and CURRENT VALUES in the active Postman environment's PRIVATE_KEY variable");
console.log("meta_scopes is a string, converting to string array");
throw new Error("Unable to coerce the META_SCOPE property value to a string array");
console.log("Ensure the Private Key is added to both INITIAL and CURRENT VALUES in the active Postman environment's PRIVATE_KEY variable.");
var sJWT = KJUR.jws.JWS.sign("RS256", sHeader, sPayload, secret);

request.description: Local signing leverages a 3rd party JSR Assign Crypto library to be loaded and locally sign the JWT Token using the provided Private Key. Using this method the Private Key even leaves the local machine, however 3rd party JavaScript is loaded into the Postman context.

item.description: This API call genereated the signed JWT Token locally and the Private Key does not leave this machine, however this set of API calls does load the JSR Assign Crypto library from a non-Adone end-point (https://kjur.github.io/jsrsasign/jsrsasign-latest-all-min.js), therefore it not recommended for use with Production credentials.

item.name: Lists all identity namespaces available for the IMS Organization

exec: // Do not send HTTP Headers with empty variables, as Postman will send the literal variable name
// Do not send HTTP URL Query Parameters with empty variables, as Postman will send the literal variable name

header.description: The access token which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration, prefixed with "Bearer ".  For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/experience-platform/tutorials/authentication.html).

The API key which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration. For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/experience-platform/tutorials/authentication.html).

The Organization ID which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration. For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/experience-platform/tutorials/authentication.html).
Identifies the Adobe Experience Platform sandbox to use. Default sandbox is 'prod'
